New Records: Scotty Pippen Jr. got his first career triple-double
Key Match Events: The Grizzlies maintained a lead of at least 20 points through the bulk of the second half

Jaren Jackson Jr. and Jonas Valanciunas got tangled with some shoving and an elbow or two flicked between the pair along with a forearm from Jaren Jackson Jr. before play was stopped and double-technicals assessed against the two centers
Post-Match Reflections: The Grizzlies maintained a lead of at least 20 points through the bulk of the second half, sending the Wizards to their third straight loss
Memphis is continually picking up the pace this season putting it in the top 5 in the league
The inexperience led to 13 turnovers in the first half, leading to 19 points as Memphis built a double-digit lead
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis continues to dominate the paint against its opponents
The Grizzlies finished right on their average of 60 points a game inside
Others: The Grizzlies beat the Washington Wizards 128-104 on Friday night for their fourth win in five games
The Wizards are dealing with injuries to key players
Up next, the Wizards visit Orlando on Sunday, and the Grizzlies visit Portland
